726929f-a.text:
Hoyt Avenue, north side, west from 31st to 29th Streets, showing the block of frame houses, seen from the Elevated station. View 2 shows the same block, seen from 29th Street. These buildings were rared in 1934 when this whole area was turned into the Grand Central Parkway approach to the Triborough Bridge. In the background is the Hellgate Bridge.
P.L. Sperr  March, 1931
NO REPRODUCTIONS  Views 1,2

726929f-b.text:
Hoyt Avenue, north side, west from 31st to 29th Streets, showing the block of frame houses, seen from the Elevated station. View 2 shows the same block, seen from 29th Street. These buildings were rared in 1934 when this whole area was turned into the Grand Central Parkway approach to the Triborough Bridge. In the background is the Hellgate Bridge.
P.L. Sperr  March, 1931
NO REPRODUCTIONS  Views 1,2

726923f-b.text:
Hoyt Avenue, north side, west frow 29th Street, showing the area where numerous buildings, among which were some of the Crystal Gardens, were torn down and where the sub-level approach to the Triborough Bridge will be constructed. Some of the Crystal Gardens buikdings on 28th Street can
be seen in view 2.
P. L. Sperr  September 20, 1934
NO REPRODUCTIONS  Views 1,2

726923f-a.text:
Hoyt Avenue, north side, west frow 29th Street, showing the area where numerous buildings, among which were some of the Crystal Gardens, were torn down and where the sub-level approach to the Triborough Bridge will be constructed. Some of the Crystal Gardens buikdings on 28th Street can
be seen in view 2.

725173f-c.text:
29th Street, north from Hoyt Avenue, view 1 showing the east side of the street only. All the houses in the immediate foreground were later raned to make way for the construction of of the Grand Central Parkway approach to the Triborough Bridge. The demolition oan be seen in view 3 which shows the N.W. corner
of 29th Street and Hoyt Avenue.
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS  Views 1,2: March, 1931
View 3: August, 1934

726922f-c.text:
Hoyt Avenue, north side, west from 29th Street. All the buildings seen here were later torn down and the area made part of the Grand Central Parkway approach to the Triborough Bridge. Views 2 and 3 show the first apartment house appearing in view 1. It is being demolished in 1934.
P. L. Sperr  Views 1,2r March 6, 1931
No REPRODUCTIONS  View 3I August 3, 1934
